00032 IOMux::IOMux(const bool B_AutoDelete)
00033   : IODevice("mux", "\n", B_AutoDelete),
00034     m_bIOLocked(false)
00035 {
00036     EnsureCommonDevices();
00037     EnsureTraces();
00038 
00039     memset(m_arpcliOutputs, '\0', sizeof(m_arpcliOutputs));
00040 }
00041 
00042 IOMux::~IOMux(void)
00043 {
00044     for (int i = 0; i < STREAM_TYPES_COUNT; i++)
00045     {
00046         SetOutput((STREAM_TYPE) i, NULL);
00047     }
00048     ResetInputList();
00049 }
00050 
00051 const bool IOMux::OpenDevice(void)
00052 {
00053     bool b_Res = true;
00054     IODevice* pcli_Input = NULL;
00055 
00056     // Input.
00057     if ((! CheckInput()) || (m_qInputs.empty()))
00058     {
00059         b_Res = false;
00060     }
00061     else
00062     {
00063         if ((pcli_Input = m_qInputs.front()))
00064         {
00065             if (! pcli_Input->OpenUp(__CALL_INFO__))
00066             {
00067                 b_Res = false;
00068             }
00069         }
00070         else
00071         {
00072             b_Res = false;
00073         }
00074     }
00075 
00076     // Outputs.
00077     for (int i = 0; i < STREAM_TYPES_COUNT; i++)
00078     {
00079         // Select default output if none is set.
00080         if (m_arpcliOutputs[i] == NULL)
00081         {
00082             if (pcli_Input != NULL)
00083             {
00084                 m_arpcliOutputs[i] = pcli_Input;
00085             }
00086             else
00087             {
00088                 m_arpcliOutputs[i] = & OutputDevice::GetNullDevice();
00089             }
00090             m_arpcliOutputs[i]->UseInstance(__CALL_INFO__);
00091         }
00092 
00093         // Open up the output device.
00094         if (m_arpcliOutputs[i] != NULL)
00095         {
00096             if (! m_arpcliOutputs[i]->OpenUp(__CALL_INFO__))
00097             {
00098                 b_Res = false;
00099             }
00100         }
00101     }
00102 
00103     if (! b_Res)
00104     {
00105         CloseDevice();
00106     }
00107     return b_Res;
00108 }
00109 
00110 const bool IOMux::CloseDevice(void)
00111 {
00112     bool b_Res = true;
00113 
00114     // Outputs.
00115     for (int i = 0; i < STREAM_TYPES_COUNT; i++)
00116     {
00117         if (m_arpcliOutputs[i] != NULL)
00118         {
00119             if (! m_arpcliOutputs[i]->CloseDown(__CALL_INFO__))
00120             {
00121                 b_Res = false;
00122             }
00123         }
00124     }
00125 
00126     // Inputs.
00127     while (! m_qInputs.empty())
00128     {
00129         if (! ReleaseFirstInputDevice())
00130         {
00131             b_Res = false;
00132         }
00133     }
00134 
00135     return b_Res;
00136 }

00138 void IOMux::PutString(const std::string& STR_Out) const
00139 {
00141     if ((m_arpcliOutputs[OUTPUT_STREAM] != NULL)
00142         // Protection against infinite loop.
00143         && (! m_bIOLocked))
00144     {
00145         m_bIOLocked = true;
00146         m_arpcliOutputs[OUTPUT_STREAM]->PutString(STR_Out);
00147         m_bIOLocked = false;
00148     }
00149 }
00150 
00151 void IOMux::Beep(void) const
00152 {
00154     if ((m_arpcliOutputs[OUTPUT_STREAM] != NULL)
00155         // Protection against infinite loop.
00156         && (! m_bIOLocked))
00157     {
00158         m_bIOLocked = true;
00159         m_arpcliOutputs[OUTPUT_STREAM]->Beep();
00160         m_bIOLocked = false;
00161     }
00162 }
00163 
00164 const KEY IOMux::GetKey(void) const
00165 {
00166     if (CheckInput() && (! m_qInputs.empty()))
00167     {
00168         if (IODevice* const pcli_Input = m_qInputs.front())
00169         {
00170             // Protection against infinite loop.
00171             if (! m_bIOLocked)
00172             {
00173                 m_bIOLocked = true;
00174                 KEY e_Key = pcli_Input->GetKey();
00175                 m_bIOLocked = false;
00176 
00177                 if (e_Key != NULL_KEY)
00178                 {
00179                     return e_Key;
00180                 }
00181                 else if (const_cast<IOMux*>(this)->NextInput())
00182                 {
00183                     return GetKey();
00184                 }
00185             }
00186         }
00187     }
00188 
00189     return cli::NULL_KEY;
00190 }
00191 
00192 const OutputDevice& IOMux::GetOutput(const STREAM_TYPE E_StreamType) const
00193 {
00194     if ((E_StreamType >= 0) && (E_StreamType < STREAM_TYPES_COUNT)
00195         && (m_arpcliOutputs[E_StreamType] != NULL))
00196     {
00197         return *m_arpcliOutputs[E_StreamType];
00198     }
00199     else
00200     {
00201         return OutputDevice::GetNullDevice();
00202     }
00203 }
00204 
00205 const bool IOMux::SetOutput(const STREAM_TYPE E_StreamType, OutputDevice* const PCLI_Stream)
00206 {
00207     // Free previous device.
00208     if (! ReleaseOutputDevice(E_StreamType, true))
00209     {
00210         return false;
00211     }
00212 
00213     // Store next device reference.
00214     m_arpcliOutputs[E_StreamType] = PCLI_Stream;
00215     // Lock the device instance.
00216     if (PCLI_Stream != NULL)
00217     {
00218         PCLI_Stream->UseInstance(__CALL_INFO__);
00219     }
00220 
00221     // Possibly open the device.
00222     if ((GetOpenUsers() > 0)
00223         && (m_arpcliOutputs[E_StreamType] != NULL)
00224         // Protection against misfunctionning.
00225         && (m_arpcliOutputs[E_StreamType] != this))
00226     {
00227         if (! m_arpcliOutputs[E_StreamType]->OpenUp(__CALL_INFO__))
00228         {
00229             return false;
00230         }
00231     }
00232 
00233     return true;
00234 }
00235 
00236 const IODevice* const IOMux::GetInput(void) const
00237 {
00238     if (! m_qInputs.empty())
00239     {
00240         return m_qInputs.front();
00241     }
00242 
00243     return NULL;
00244 }
00245 
00246 const bool IOMux::AddInput(IODevice* const PCLI_Input)
00247 {
00248     if (PCLI_Input != NULL)
00249     {
00250         m_qInputs.push_back(PCLI_Input);
00251         PCLI_Input->UseInstance(__CALL_INFO__);
00252     }
00253 
00254     return true;
00255 }
00256 
00257 const bool IOMux::NextInput(void)
00258 {
00259     // Terminate head device.
00260     if (! m_qInputs.empty())
00261     {
00262         if (! ReleaseFirstInputDevice())
00263         {
00264             return false;
00265         }
00266     }
00267 
00268     // Prepare next device.
00269     if (CheckInput() && (! m_qInputs.empty()))
00270     {
00271         if (IODevice* const pcli_Input = m_qInputs.front())
00272         {
00273             if (GetOpenUsers() > 0)
00274             {
00275                 if (! pcli_Input->OpenUp(__CALL_INFO__))
00276                 {
00277                     // Open failure.
00278                     return false;
00279                 }
00280             }
00281 
00282             // Successful return.
00283             return true;
00284         }
00285     }
00286 
00287     // Default return indicates a failure.
00288     return false;
00289 }
00290 
00291 const bool IOMux::ResetInputList(void)
00292 {
00293     bool b_Res = true;
00294 
00295     while (! m_qInputs.empty())
00296     {
00297         if (! ReleaseFirstInputDevice())
00298         {
00299             b_Res = false;
00300         }
00301     }
00302 
00303     return b_Res;
00304 }
00305 
00306 IODevice* const IOMux::CreateInputDevice(void)
00307 {
00308     return NULL;
00309 }
00310 
00311 const bool IOMux::CheckInput(void) const
00312 {
00313     if (m_qInputs.empty())
00314     {
00315         // Input needed.
00316         if (IODevice* const pcli_Input = const_cast<IOMux*>(this)->CreateInputDevice())
00317         {
00318             const_cast<IOMux*>(this)->AddInput(pcli_Input);
00319             if (GetOpenUsers() > 0)
00320             {
00321                 // Input should be opened.
00322                 if (! pcli_Input->OpenUp(__CALL_INFO__))
00323                 {
00324                     // Open failure.
00325                     return false;
00326                 }
00327             }
00328         }
00329         else if (m_qInputs.empty())
00330         {
00331             // No more input.
00332             return false;
00333         }
00334     }
00335 
00336     // Successful return.
00337     return true;
00338 }
00339 
00340 const bool IOMux::ReleaseFirstInputDevice(void)
00341 {
00342     if (! m_qInputs.empty())
00343     {
00344         bool b_Res = true;
00345 
00346         if (IODevice* const pcli_Input = m_qInputs.front())
00347         {
00348             if (GetOpenUsers() > 0)
00349             {
00350                 // Close the device if needed.
00351                 if (! pcli_Input->CloseDown(__CALL_INFO__))
00352                 {
00353                     b_Res = false;
00354                 }
00355             }
00356             // Free the device instance.
00357             pcli_Input->FreeInstance(__CALL_INFO__);
00358         }
00359 
00360         // Remove device reference.
00361         m_qInputs.pop_front();
00362 
00363         return b_Res;
00364     }
00365     else
00366     {
00367         return false;
00368     }
00369 }
00370 
00371 const bool IOMux::ReleaseOutputDevice(const STREAM_TYPE E_StreamType, const bool B_Delete)
00372 {
00373     bool b_Res = true;
00374 
00375     if (m_arpcliOutputs[E_StreamType] != NULL)
00376     {
00377         if (GetOpenUsers() > 0)
00378         {
00379             // Close the device if needed.
00380             if (! m_arpcliOutputs[E_StreamType]->CloseDown(__CALL_INFO__))
00381             {
00382                 b_Res = false;
00383             }
00384         }
00385         // Release the device instance.
00386         m_arpcliOutputs[E_StreamType]->FreeInstance(__CALL_INFO__);
00387 
00388         // Remove reference.
00389         m_arpcliOutputs[E_StreamType] = NULL;
00390     }
00391 
00392     return b_Res;
00393 }
